member.name: P:Sitecore.FXM.Configuration.FxmSettings.BaseHostDomain
member.summary: Defines the common base domain of the Sitecore instance and the externally tracked sites if all are hosted on a common base domain, but on different sub domains.

member.name: P:Sitecore.FXM.Configuration.FxmSettings.ShareSessionsWhenPossible
member.summary: The setting name specifying whether or not analytics interactions across the Sitecore site and any external site being tracked, should be shared. Note that session sharing won't be possible for users on Safari or IE 8 and 9, and in these cases sessions will unique between sites, as is the default behavior.

member.name: P:Sitecore.FXM.Configuration.FxmSettings.P3PHeaderValue
member.summary: The setting name specifying the P3P header value to use for Tracking Beacon API responses. This allows for credentials (cookies) to be set by IE 10 and 11 for CORS requests made across domains to the Beacon API.

member.name: M:Sitecore.FXM.SessionManagement.FxmSessionIdManager.InitializeRequest(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Performs per-request initialization of the SessionIDManager object.
member.param: The HttpContext object that contains information about the current request.
True if the session-ID manager should redirect to determine cookie support; otherwise, false to suppress automatic redirection to determine cookie support.

When this method returns, contains a Boolean that indicates whether the ISessionIDManager object supports issuing new session IDs when the original ID is out of date. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: True to indicate that the initialization performed a redirect; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Sitecore.FXM.SessionManagement.FxmSessionIdManager.GetSessionID(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: Gets the session identifier from the context of the current HTTP request.
member.param: The current HttpContext object that references server objects used to process HTTP requests (for example, the Request and Response properties).
member.returns: The current session identifier sent with the HTTP request.

member.name: M:Sitecore.FXM.SessionManagement.FxmSessionIdManager.CreateSessionID(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.param: The current HttpContext object that references server objects used to process HTTP requests (for example, the Request and Response properties).

member.name: M:Sitecore.FXM.SessionManagement.FxmSessionIdManager.SaveSessionID(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Session ID is preserved in the session state object and doesn't need to be saved to the response, as FXM does that on the client in the external domain.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a Boolean value that is true if the response is redirected to the current URL with the session identifier added to the URL; otherwise, false.
When this method returns, contains a Boolean value that is true if a cookie has been added to the HTTP response; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Deletes the session identifier from the cookie or from the URL.

member.summary: Confirms that the supplied session identifier is valid.
member.returns: true if the session identifier is valid; otherwise, false.

member.summary: The optional manually configured common base host name between the Sitecore hosting domain and external sites being tracked.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Sitecore.FXM.Tracking.BaseDomainExtractor.Extract(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines the common base domain between two host names - a Sitecore host name and an external site host name. Honors a manually configured override to help determine the edge cases when its very difficult to determine a common base domain.
member.param: The domain of the Sitecore site.
The domain of the external site.
member.returns: A common base domain of the two host names supplied. If no commonality found, the Sitecore domain is preferred.

member.name: M:Sitecore.FXM.Tracking.ITrackingManager.TrackPageVisit(System.Web.HttpRequestBase,Sitecore.FXM.Tracking.SpoofedHttpRequestBase,System.Web.HttpResponseBase,System.String)
member.summary: Track a page visit in the current session according to the analytics contact id supplied.
member.param: The current Http request. The request object is prepared before running the core analytics pipelines. Note however that this instance is not injected into the core pipelines - they directly reference the static ASP.NET request properties.

The current Http response. The response object is modified after running the core analytics pipelines. Note however that this instance is not injected into the core pipelines - they directly reference the static ASP.NET request properties.
member.returns: The of the operation. An exception is thrown for truly unexpected errors.

member.name: M:Sitecore.FXM.Tracking.ITrackingManager.TrackPageEvent(Sitecore.FXM.Tracking.EventDescriptors.ITrackDescriptor,System.String,System.Web.HttpRequestBase,Sitecore.FXM.Tracking.SpoofedHttpRequestBase,System.Web.HttpResponseBase)
member.summary: Track an event on the current page. If the current page is not the last tracked or current page in the session then the operation will fail - an event must be registered for an existing page visit.
member.param: Descriptor with metadata for the event that should tracked.

The current Http request. The request object is prepared before running the core analytics pipelines. Note however that this instance is not injected into the core pipelines - they directly reference the static ASP.NET request properties.

The current Http response. The response object is modified after running the core analytics pipelines. Note however that this instance is not injected into the core pipelines - they directly reference the static ASP.NET request properties.
member.returns: The of the operation. An exception is thrown for truly unexpected errors.

member.name: T:Sitecore.ItemCanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Can be appplied to symbols of types derived from IEnumerable as well as to symbols of Task and Lazy classes to indicate that the value of a collection item, of the Task.Result property or of the Lazy.Value property can be null.

member.name: T:Sitecore.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output.
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally (throws or terminates the process).
Value canbenull is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon. There is no notion of order rows, all rows are checked for applicability and applied per each program state tracked by R# analysis.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("=> true, result: notnull; => false, result: null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)
